snippet: Export growth remained in the single-digit range in August and imports shrank, falling short of expectations and adding to speculation that the government will expand stimulus measures.
abstract: Chinese exports rose 2.7 percent in August from August 2011, and imports fell 2.6 percent from a year ago, falling short of expectations and adding to speculation that the government will expand stimulus measures.
lead_paragraph: Export growth remained in the single-digit range in August and imports shrank, falling short of expectations and adding to speculation that the government will expand stimulus measures.

headline.seo: Exports From China Slow as Imports Shrink
headline.main: Trade Data Reinforces Slowdown in Chinese Economy
headline.print_headline: Trade Data Confirms Economic Slowdown in China
